TunableList.name: actor_continuation
TunableList.description: If specified, a continuation to push on the actor when a picker selection has been made.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push as a continuation on the specified actor Sim.

TunableVariant.name: carry_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a carry target for this continuation.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will set as a carry target.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_carry_target
TunableVariant.description: Item in inventory (of continuations actor) to use as carry target for continuation if carry target is None

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The base definition to look for inside inventory. Objects that redirect (like counters) will match if base definition is the same.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The exact object definition to look for inside inventory.

TunableTuple.name: object_with_tag
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: preserve_preferred_object
Tunable.description: If checked, the pushed interaction's preferred objects are determined by the current preferred objects. If unchecked, the transition sequence would not award bonuses to any specific part.

Tunable.name: preserve_target_part
Tunable.description: If checked, the pushed interaction will use the same target part if applicable. Defaults to false because typically we will want to let the transition select which part to use.

Tunable.name: si_affordance_override
Tunable.description: When the tuned affordance is a mixer for a different SI, use this to specify the mixer's appropriate SI. This is useful for pushing socials.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will target.

TunableTuple.name: continuation_linking
TunableTuple.description: How/if to link the continuations pushed by this picker. Specify which continuations should be cancelled if any of the other continuations are cancelled.

Tunable.name: cancel_entire_chain
Tunable.description: By default (False) only the specific continuation pushed on the target specified by continuation to cancel will be cancelled if any other continuation (or it's continuations) are cancelled. If true, that continuation as well as any continuations of that continuation will be cancelled. e.g. actorA continuation continues to actorB or actorC targetA continuation continues to targetB or targetC if 'continuations to cancel' is TARGET or ALL then if this is false, canceling actorA, actorB, or actorC will cancel targetA ONLY. If the target has already continued to targetB or targetC they will remain untouched. However if this true, canceling actorA, actorB, or actorC will cancel targetA, targetB, or targetC if the target has already continued on to either of them.

TunableEnum.name: continuations_to_cancel
TunableEnum.description: Whose, if any, continuations pushed by this picker should cancel if any of the other continuations pushed by this picker are canceled. e.g. if 'ACTOR' is selected, then if the target continuation or any of the picked continuations are canceled the actor continuation will also be canceled. Note: Currently, if there is no actor or target continuation then no link occurs.

Tunable.name: continuations_are_multi_push
Tunable.description: If true, will attempt to push all the continuations on each of the respective sims in order. If False will stop pushing for each sim after an interaction has been successfully pushed. For picked continuations, this is ignored if continuations are sequential.

Tunable.name: continuations_are_sequential
Tunable.description: This specifies that the continuations tuned in picked_continuation are applied sequentially to the list of picked sims. e.g. The first continuation will be pushed on the first picked sim. The second continuation will be pushed on the second picked sim, etc. Note: There should never be more picked sims than continuations, however, there can be less picked sims than continuations, to allow for cases where the number of sims is a range.

Tunable.name: create_sim_if_no_valid_choices
Tunable.display: Create Sim If No Valid Choices
Tunable.description: If checked, this picker will generate a sim that matches the tuned filter if no other matching sims are available. This sim will match the tuned filter, but not necessarily respect other rules of this picker (like radius, tests, or instantiation). If you need one of those things, see a GPE about improving this option.

Tunable.name: include_actor_sim
Tunable.description: If checked then the actor sim can be included in the picker options and will not be blacklisted.

Tunable.name: include_instantiated_sims
Tunable.description: If unchecked, instantiated sims will never be available in the picker. if checked, they must still pass the filters and tests.

Tunable.name: include_missing_pets
Tunable.description: If unchecked, missing pet sims will never be available in the picker. if checked, they must still pass the filters and tests.

Tunable.name: include_rabbithole_sims
Tunable.description: If unchecked, rabbithole sims will never be available in the picker. if checked, they must still pass the filters and tests.

Tunable.name: include_target_sim
Tunable.description: If checked then the target sim can be included in the picker options and will not be blacklisted.

Tunable.name: include_uninstantiated_sims
Tunable.description: If unchecked, uninstantiated sims will never be available in the picker. if checked, they must still pass the filters and tests This is an optimization tunable.

Tunable.name: multi_select
Tunable.description: By default AutonomousSimPicker only picks one sim, however it can be tuned to select all of them when needed

TunableVariant.name: order_by_proximity
TunableVariant.description: If order_by_proximity is enabled, we find the nearest sim to this Participant.

TunableList.name: picked_continuation
TunableList.description: If specified, a continuation to push on each sim selected in the picker.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push as a continuation on the specified actor Sim.

TunableVariant.name: carry_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a carry target for this continuation.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will set as a carry target.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_carry_target
TunableVariant.description: Item in inventory (of continuations actor) to use as carry target for continuation if carry target is None

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The base definition to look for inside inventory. Objects that redirect (like counters) will match if base definition is the same.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The exact object definition to look for inside inventory.

TunableTuple.name: object_with_tag
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: preserve_preferred_object
Tunable.description: If checked, the pushed interaction's preferred objects are determined by the current preferred objects. If unchecked, the transition sequence would not award bonuses to any specific part.

Tunable.name: preserve_target_part
Tunable.description: If checked, the pushed interaction will use the same target part if applicable. Defaults to false because typically we will want to let the transition select which part to use.

Tunable.name: si_affordance_override
Tunable.description: When the tuned affordance is a mixer for a different SI, use this to specify the mixer's appropriate SI. This is useful for pushing socials.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will target.

TunableVariant.name: radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then Sim must be in a certain range for consideration. This should only be enabled when include_instantiated_sims is True and include_uninstantiated_sims is False.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Sim must be in a certain range for consideration.

TunableVariant.name: sim_filter
TunableVariant.description: Optional Sim Filter to run Sims through. Otherwise we will just get all Sims that pass the tests.

Tunable.name: sim_filter_selected
Tunable.description: Sim Filter to run all Sims through before tests.

TunableVariant.name: sim_filter_household_override
TunableVariant.description: Sim filter by default uses the actor's household for household- related filter terms, such as the In Family filter term. If this is enabled, a different participant's household will be used. If the participant is an object instead of a Sim, the object's owner household will be used.

TunableEnum.name: sim_filter_requesting_sim
TunableEnum.description: Determine which Sim filter requests are relative to. For example, if you want all Sims in a romantic relationship with the target, tune TargetSim here, and then a relationship filter. NOTE: Tuning filters is, performance-wise, preferable to tests.

TdescFragTag.name: sim_tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that are run against the prospective sims. At least one test must pass in order for the prospective sim to show. All sims will pass if there are no tests. Picked_sim is the participant type for the prospective sim.

TunableList.name: success_loot_actions
TunableList.description: List of loot actions to apply on successful picker selection.

TunableList.name: target_continuation
TunableList.description: If specified, a continuation to push on the target sim when a picker selection has been made.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push as a continuation on the specified actor Sim.

TunableVariant.name: carry_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a carry target for this continuation.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will set as a carry target.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_carry_target
TunableVariant.description: Item in inventory (of continuations actor) to use as carry target for continuation if carry target is None

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The base definition to look for inside inventory. Objects that redirect (like counters) will match if base definition is the same.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The exact object definition to look for inside inventory.

TunableTuple.name: object_with_tag
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: preserve_preferred_object
Tunable.description: If checked, the pushed interaction's preferred objects are determined by the current preferred objects. If unchecked, the transition sequence would not award bonuses to any specific part.

Tunable.name: preserve_target_part
Tunable.description: If checked, the pushed interaction will use the same target part if applicable. Defaults to false because typically we will want to let the transition select which part to use.

Tunable.name: si_affordance_override
Tunable.description: When the tuned affordance is a mixer for a different SI, use this to specify the mixer's appropriate SI. This is useful for pushing socials.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will target.

Tunable.name: test_compatibility
Tunable.description: If checked then the actor continuation will be tested for interaction compatibility.
